sentences.text: A Letter to Our Shareholders from the Chairperson of Our Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Invesco Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our multi-year strategic objectives help us deliver strong outcomes for clients and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see Our multi-year strategic objectives and annual operating plan beginning on page 28.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It has been my great honor to serve on the Board of Directors of Invesco since 2009 and as Chairperson since 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Board are very aware that we are here because you have entrusted us to be stewards of your investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to maintaining a client-focused culture and aligning the firms highly talented people with our multi-year strategic objectives, which enables Invesco to deliver strong, long-term investment performance to clients and further advance our competitive position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe firmly that if we help clients achieve their investment objectives and manage our business effectively and efficiently, we can continue to deliver strong results to shareholders over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board takes seriously our duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below are a few of the many areas in which the Board focused its attention in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Composition and Effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are rightly interested in the composition and effectiveness of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board remains committed to ensuring that it is composed of a highly capable group of directors who are well-equipped to oversee the success of the company and effectively represent the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing our Board with the appropriate balance of expertise, experience, continuity, as well as new perspectives is an important component to a well-functioning board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is excited to welcome Ms. Beshar to its membership following the 2017 Annual General Meeting and believes that she possesses the skills and qualifications to make a significant contribution to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys diversity of thought of its employees, which is embraced by the Board as well, is an essential element of Invescos culture and helps us manage the company for the benefit of clients and shareholders over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to review the qualifications, skills and experience that we have identified as important attributes for directors of our company and how they match up to each of our directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to strong governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding our corporate governance practices, see Corporate Governance beginning on page 13.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It has always been the aim of the Board to operate in the most effective and efficient manner possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, each year the Board, with the assistance of an external advisor specializing in corporate governance, conducts an evaluation of the performance of our Board and each of its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors participate in one-on-one interviews with the advisor, receive in-person feedback from the advisor based on confidential and private interviews, and determine if the Board needs to modify its activities to enhance further the operations of the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the interviews of each director, interviews are also conducted with those members of senior management who work with and observe the operation of the Board on a regular basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach and Our Proxy Access Proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we conduct the activities of the Board, a key priority is ensuring robust outreach and engagement with you, the owners of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Partnering with management, we receive feedback from shareholders throughout the year on a variety of topics, including governance and executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We listen and carefully consider your perspectives in our decision-making process and make enhancements to our governance and executive compensation programs, including those described herein, based on your input.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to shareholder engagement and encourage an open dialogue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on how to communicate with our Board, see Important Additional Information beginning on page 74.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board has unanimously adopted and is submitting to you for approval amendments to our bye-laws that would implement proxy access  facilitating eligible shareholders to include their director nominees in the companys proxy materials for an annual general meeting of shareholders, along with candidates nominated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to considering the views of our shareholders and believes our Proxy Access provisions provide meaningful rights to our long-term shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see Proposal 4 in our Proxy Statement for a further description of Proxy Access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are structured to align rewards with long-term client and shareholder success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding our executive compensation programs, see Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 25.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To support our multi-year strategic objectives, the Boards compensation committee has structured our compensation programs for our executives, investment professionals and other employees to align individual rewards with client and shareholder success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our engagement with shareholders in the fall and winter of 2016 reaffirmed our belief that our compensation programs are sound and appropriately aligned with the long- term interests of our clients and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, our shareholders positively acknowledged our recent enhancements to our compensation programs that more effectively link the programs with the companys progress against its strategic objectives, annual operating plan and long-term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we recently transitioned the performance period for our long-term, performance-based equity awards from a one-year to a three-year performance period and further strengthened our vesting thresholds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to continuing to engage with shareholders and encourages an open dialogue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please continue to share your thoughts with us on any topic as we value your input, investment and support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established a process to facilitate communication by shareholders with Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications can be addressed to the Board of Directors in care of the Office of the Company Secretary, Invesco Ltd., 1555 Peachtree Street NE, Atlanta, Georgia 30309 or by e-mail to company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: secretary@invesco.com.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the 2017 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders of Invesco Ltd., which will be held on Thursday, May 11, 2017, at 1:00 p.m., Central Time, at the Langham Hotel, located at 330 N. Wabash Avenue, Chicago, Illinois 60611.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy statement summary For a convenient overview of the matters to be voted on at our Annual General Meeting, see Proxy Statement Summary beginning on page 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important and we encourage you to vote promptly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you are able to attend the meeting in person, please follow the instructions contained in the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) on how to vote via the Internet or via the toll-free telephone number, or request a paper proxy card to complete, sign and return by mail so that your shares may be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of the Board of Directors, I extend our appreciation for your continued support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yours sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ben F. Johnson III Chairperson

sentences.text: Proxy Statement Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 highlights In spite of challenging market conditions, Invesco continued to execute well against our strategic objectives described below, which enabled us to deliver strong, long-term investme performance to clients and further advance our competitive position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, our financial performance for 2016 was lower year-over-year, reflecting volatile markets, numerous headwinds in the operating environment of many markets we serve and efforts to invest in our business for the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a review of the companys financial performance, our Compensation Committee decided that the company-wide incentive pool should be reduced for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as part of its rigorous and judicious executive compensation decision-making, our Compensation Committee determined that our chief executive officers total incentive compensation should be reduced by approximately 11%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board currently has nine directors.

sentences.text: A director holds office until such directors successor has been duly elected and qualified or until such directors death, resignation or removal from office under our Bye-Laws.

sentences.text: Each director is elected for a one-year term.

sentences.text: There are nine director nominees standing for election at the 2017 Annual General Meeting.

sentences.text: Mr. Edward Lawrence has not been nominated for re-election because he has reached the mandatory retirement age.

sentences.text: The Board has nominated Sarah E. Beshar, Joseph R. Canion, Martin L. Flanagan, C. Robert Henrikson, Ben F. Johnson III, Denis Kessler, Sir Nigel Sheinwald, G. Richard Wagoner, Jr. and Phoebe A. Wood for election as directors of the company for a term ending at the 2018 Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Canion, Flanagan, Henrikson, Johnson, Kessler, Sheinwald, Wagoner and Ms. Wood are current directors of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Beshar is a new director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is excited to welcome Ms. Beshar to its membership following the 2017 Annual General Meeting and believes that she possesses the skills and qualifications to make a significant contribution to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further information regarding the nominees is shown on the following pages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee has indicated to the company that he or she would serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not anticipate that any director nominee will be unable to stand for election, but if that were to happen, the Board may reduce the size of the Board, designate a substitute or leave a vacancy unfilled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a substitute is designated, proxies voting on the original director nominee will be cast for the substituted candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Bye-Laws, at any general meeting held for the purpose of electing directors at which a quorum is present, each director nominee receiving a majority of the votes cast at the meeting will be elected as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee for director who is an incumbent director is not elected and no successor has been elected at the meeting, the director is required under our Bye-Laws to submit his or her resignation as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nomination and Corporate Governance Committee would then make a recommendation to the full Board on whether to accept or reject the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the resignation is not accepted by the Board, the director will continue to serve until the next annual general meeting and until his or her successor is duly elected, or his or her earlier resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the directors resignation is accepted by the Board, then the Board may fill the vacancy.

sentences.text: Director independence For a director to be considered independent, the Board must affirmatively determine that the director does not have any material relationship with the company either directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such determinations are made and disclosed according to applicable rules established by the New York Y Stock Exchange (NYSE) or other applicable rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its independence determinations with respect to director nominee Sarah E. Beshar, the Board considered
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a real estate lease by the company of certain office space located in New York, Y New York Y from Marsh & McLennan (MMC) which employs Ms. Beshars spouse as an executive officer, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) various human resources-related transactional and administration services (e.g., third-party benefits administration and benchmarking market data) which are non-professional and non- advisory in nature provided by subsidiaries of MMC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total amount paid to MMC in 2016 for all such items was less than one percent (1%) of MMCs 2016 publicly reported revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the rules of the NYSE, the Board has affirmatively determined that it is currently composed of a majority of independent directors, and that the following current directors and director nominee are independent and do not have a material relationship with the company: Sarah E. Beshar, Joseph R. Canion, C. Robert Henrikson, Ben F. Johnson III, Denis Kessler, Edward P. Lawrence, Sir Nigel Sheinwald, G. Richard Wagoner, Jr. and Phoebe A. Wood.

sentences.text: The Board is excited to welcome Ms. Beshar to its membership following the 2017 Annual General Meeting and believes that she possesses the skills and qualifications to make a significant contribution to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Board considers new director nominees, it takes into account a number of factors, including nominees that have skills that will match the needs of the companys long-term global strategy and will bring diversity of thought, global perspective, experience and background to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on our director nomination process, see Information about our Board and its Committees  the Nomination and Corporate Governance Committee below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate governance guidelines The Board has adopted Corporate Gover
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines (Guidelines) and Terms of Reference for our Chairperson and for our Chief Executive Officer, each of which is available in the corporate governance section of the companys website at www.invesco.com (the companys website).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Guidelines set forth the practices the Board follows with respect to, among other matters, the composition of the Board, director responsibilities, Board committees, director access to officers, employees and independent advisors, director compensation and performance evaluation of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board leadership structure As described in the Guidelines, t
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the Guidelines, the companys business is conducted day-to-day by its officers, managers and employees, under the direction of the Chief Executive Officer and the oversight of the Board, to serve the interest of our clients and enhance the long-term value of the company for its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is elected by the shareholders to oversee our management team and to seek to assure that the long-term interests of the shareholders are being served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of these differences in the fundamental roles of the Board and management, the company has chosen to separate the Chief Executive Officer and Board chairperson positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes separation of these roles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) allows the Board more effectively to monitor and evaluate objectively the performance of the Chief Executive Officer, such that the Chief Executive Officer is more likely to be held accountable for his performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) allows the non-executive chairperson to control the Boards agenda and information flow, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) creates an atmosphere in which other directors are more likely to challenge the Chief Executive Officer and other members of our senior management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons, the company believes that this board leadership structure is currently the most appropriate structure for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the Board may reassess the appropriateness of the existing structure at any time, including following changes in board composition, in management or in the character of the companys business and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of conduct and directors code of conduct As part of our ethics and compliance program, our Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our ethics and compliance program, our Board has approved a code of ethics (the Code of Conduct) that applies to our principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer and persons performing similar functions, as well as to our other officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct is posted on the companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have adopted a separate Directors Code of Conduct that applies to all members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to satisfy the disclosure requirement regarding any amendment to, or a waiver of, a provision of the Code of Conduct for our directors and executive officers by posting such information on the companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company maintains a compliance reporting line, where employees and individuals outside the company can anonymously submit a complaint or concern regarding compliance with applicable laws, rules or regulations, the Code of Conduct, as well as accounting, auditing, ethical or other concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards role in risk oversight The Board has principal responsibility for oversight of the companys risk management processes and for understanding the overall risk profile of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Though Board committees routinely address specific risks and risk processes within their purview, the Board has not delegated primary risk oversight responsibility to a committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our risk management framework provides the basis for consistent and meaningful risk dialogue up, down and across the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Global Performance Measurement and Risk Group assesses core investment risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Risk Management Committee assesses strategic, operational and all other business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A network of business unit, specific and geographic risk management committees, under the auspices of the Corporate Risk Management Committee, maintains an ongoing risk assessment, management and monitoring process that provides a bottom-up perspective on the specific risk areas existing in various domains of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each Board meeting, the Board reviews and discusses with senior management information pertaining to risk provided by the Global Performance Measurement and Risk Group and the Corporate Risk Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our risk management framework
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Executive Management Team Risk Areas of Focus Investment Credit/Asset/Liability Financial Operational Business Strategy Global Performance Measurement and Risk Group Corporate Risk Management Committee Investment Risk Management Business/Operational Risk Management Compliance and Internal Audit
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each Board meeting, the Board reviews and discusses with senior management information pertaining to risk provided by the Global Performance Measurement and Risk Group and the Corporate Risk Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these sessions senior management reviews and discusses with the Board the most significant risks facing the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also reviewed and approved the companys risk appetite statement and crisis management framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By receiving these regular reports, the Board maintains a practical understanding of the risk philosophy and risk appetite of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Board and committee agenda items on various topics regarding our business include discussion on risks inherent in our business as well as those introduced by new business developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through this regular and consistent risk communication, the Board has reasonable assurance that all material risks of the company are being addressed and that the company is propagating a risk-aware culture in which effective risk management is built into the fabric of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee annually assesses the risks of our compensation policies and practices for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has concluded our policies and practices do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reaching this conclusion, the Compensation Committee considered the input of a working group comprised of representatives from our human resources and finance departments that reviewed each of Invescos compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invescos compensation programs are designed to reward success over the long-term, promote a longer term view of risk and return in decision making and protect against incentives for inappropriate risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples of risk mitigation in our compensation program design include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers several performance metrics in establishing the company-wide annual incentive pool each year, so no one metric creates an undue reward that might encourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not attempt to rank or assign relative weight to any factor, but instead applies its judgment in considering them in their entirety;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vast majority of investment professional bonus plans have multi-year measurement periods, caps on earnings and discretionary components;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sales and commission plans generally contain multiple performance measures and discretionary elements; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives receive a substantial portion of compensation in the form of long-term equity that vests over multi-year periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-based equity awards vest ratably over a four-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based equity awards are subject to a three-year performance period and three- year cliff vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in the past, the financial performance for the performance-based equity awards must be certified by the Compensation Committee and the awards are subject to a clawback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are also subject to our stock ownership policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee routinely receives reports from the control functions of finance, legal, compliance and internal audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Global Head of Internal Audit reports to the Chairperson of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the internal audit functions planning and resource allocation in a manner designed to ensure testing of controls and other internal audit activities are appropriately prioritized in a risk-based manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also seeks to assure that appropriate risk-based inputs from management and internal audit are communicated to the companys independent public auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board annually reviews its own performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards annual performance evaluation As part of its annual performance evaluation of the Board and each of its committees, the Board engages an independent external advisor specializing in corporate governance to coordinate the Boards self assessment by its members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisor has each director complete a questionnaire and then performs one-on-one confidential interviews with directors and prepares a report for the Boards review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisor presents the report in person to the Board, and the Board discusses the evaluation to determine what action, if any, could further enhance the operations of the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the questionnaire and interviews of each director, interviews are also conducted with those members of senior management who attend Board meetings on a regular basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco recognizes our responsibility to help sustain a healthy, clean environment for future generations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investment and corporate stewardship - environmental, social and governance responsibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: responsibility As a global investment management organization, Invesco is committed to adopting and implementing responsible investment principles in a manner that is consistent with our fiduciary responsibilities to clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco recognizes the importance of considering environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues as part of a robust investment process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, Invescos corporate stewardship programs focus on human capital development and our responsibility to help sustain a healthy, clean environment for future generations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to fostering greater transparency and continuous improvement with regard to investment and corporate stewardship within our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below are some of the actions Invesco is taking to meet these stewardship commitments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2013, Invesco became a signatory to the United Nations Principles for Responsible Investment (PRI), which is the leading global responsible investment network of investment managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invescos most recent annual rating from PRI on Proxy Voting and Governance is an A. Invescos PRI transparency report is publicly available at www.unpri.org.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco is also a signatory to the UK Stewardship Code and Japan Stewardship Code, which, like PRI, promote active engagement in corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information about Invescos commitment to Principles for Responsible Investment is available under the About Us tab on the companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our company is a constituent of the FTSE4Good Index Series, which seeks to help investors identify organizations with good track records of corporate social responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco believes the voting of proxies should be managed with the same care as all other elements of the investment process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy voting process at Invesco, which is driven by investment professionals, focuses on maximizing long-term value for our clients, protecting clients rights and promoting governance structures and practices that reinforce the accountability of corporate management and boards of directors to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invescos Policy Statement on Global Corporate Governance and Proxy Voting is also available under the About Us tab on the companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Invesco Environmental Steering Committee, which includes executive management representation, oversees and drives the companys global environmental policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee monitors environmental impacts, gathers ideas and suggestions for improving our global environmental management, and approves initiatives that drive our regional management processes to align with our global environmental policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco ranked #1 out of 10 companies in the U.S. capital markets industry and #9 out of 93 companies in the financial sector in the 2016 Newsweek Green Rankings, which assessed the corporate environmental performance of the worlds largest publicly traded companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco has also made significant progress in reducing our impact on the environment at a number of our global locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Atlanta, Dublin, Frankfurt, Henley, Houston, Hyderabad, London, New York, Y Prince Edward Island and Toronto locations, which comprise approximately 80% of Invescos employees around the world, are ISO 14001 registered  a certification that Invesco has the framework in place to effectively manage its environmental responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco has received certification in the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Hyderabad office achieved the highest platinum standard, while our New York Y office achieved the gold standard and our Atlanta headquarters and Houston office achieved the silver standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LEED certification is globally recognized as the premier mark of achievement in green building.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco participates in the Carbon Disclosure Project, reporting on carbon emissions and reduction management processes, and our commitment to sound environmental practices is summarized in our Global Environmental Policy Statement found under the About Us tab on the companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco values our employees and their diverse perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our company provides equal opportunity in its employment and promotion practices and encourages employees to play active roles in the growth and development of the communities in which they live and work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco conducts regular employee surveys to monitor employee satisfaction with results showing consistently high levels of employee engagement driven by many positive factors including employees perspectives regarding ethics and values at the company, the companys strategy and direction, and opportunity for personal development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, our employee engagement scores exceed the global high performing organizations norm, a relevant benchmark provided by our employee survey provider, Willis Towers Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are compensated with a meaningful mix of total rewards to help plan for retirement, stay healthy and maintain a work-life balance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rewards include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comprehensive health and wellness programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement savings plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Life insurance plans and income-protection benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holiday and time-off benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Flexibility to help balance work and family responsibilitie
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rich opportunities to develop professional skills and knowledge
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Opportunities to contribute to their community
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Opportunities to become an Invesco shareholder through our employee stock purchase plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended at least seventy-five percent (75%) of the aggregate of the total number of meetings held by the Board and the total number of meetings held by all committees of the Board on which he or she served during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not have a formal policy regarding Board member attendance at shareholder meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eight of our nine directors then in office attended the 2016 Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director not attending the meeting was unable to be present due to the directors travel schedule.

sentences.text: The non-executive directors (those directors who are not officers or employees of the company and who are classified as independent directors under applicable NYSE standards) meet in executive session generally at each of the Boards in-person meetings each year and at least once per year during a regularly scheduled Board meeting without management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee met five times during 2016.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is comprised of at least three members of the Board, each of whom is independent of the company under the NYSE and SEC rules;

sentences.text: The charter sets forth the committees responsibilities, which include establishing procedures for identifying and evaluating potential nominees for director, recommending to the Board potential nominees for election, periodically reviewing and reassessing the adequacy of the Guidelines to determine whether any changes are appropriate and recommending any such changes to the Board for its approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidates proposed for election in Proposal No. 1 of this Proxy Statement were unanimously recommended by the committee to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes there are certain minimum qualifications that each director nominee must satisfy in order to be suitable for a position on the Board, including that such nominee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be an individual of the highest integrity and have an inquiring mind, a willingness to ask hard questions and the ability to work well with others;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be free of any conflict of interest that would violate any applicable law or regulation or interfere with the proper performance of the responsibilities of a director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be willing and able to devote sufficient time to the affairs of the company and be diligent in fulfilling the responsibilities of a director and Board committee member; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have the capacity and desire to represent the best interests of the shareholders as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering candidates for director nominee, the committee generally assembles all information regarding a candidates background and qualifications, evaluates a candidates mix of skills and qualifications and determines the contribution that the candidate could be expected to make to the overall functioning of the Board, giving due consideration to the Boards balance of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the committee routinely considers diversity as a part of its deliberations, it has no formal policy regarding diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to current directors, the committee considers past participation in and contributions to the activities of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee recommends director nominees to the Board based on its assessment of overall suitability to serve in accordance with the companys policy regarding nominations and qualifications of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will consider candidates recommended for nomination to the Board by shareholders of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may nominate candidates for election to the Board under Bermuda law and our Bye-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The manner in which the committee evaluates candidates recommended by shareholders would be generally the same as any other candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the committee would also seek and consider information concerning any relationship between a shareholder recommending a candidate and the candidate to determine if the candidate can represent the interests of all of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee would not evaluate a candidate recommended by a shareholder unless the shareholders proposal provides that the potential candidate has indicated a willingness to serve as a director, to comply with the expectations and requirements for Board service as publicly disclosed by the company and to provide all of the information necessary to conduct an evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amendments would become effective upon the required approval by our shareholders, see Proposal No. 4 - Amendment to the Company's Second Amended and Restated Bye-Laws to Implement Proxy Access and Other Matters.

sentences.text: Director compensation Directors who are Invesco employees do not receive compensation for their services as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of its charter, the Compensation Committee annually reviews and determines the compensation paid to non-executive directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing and determining non-executive director compensation, the committee considers, among other things, the following policies and principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that compensation should fairly pay the non-executive directors for the work, time commitment and efforts required by directors of an organization of the companys size and scope of business activities, including service on Board committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that a component of the compensation should be designed to align the non-executive directors interests with the long-term interests of the companys shareholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: that non-executive directors independence may be compromised or impaired for Board or committee purposes if director compensation exceeds customary levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a part of its annual review, the committee engaged Johnson Associates, Inc. as a third- party consultant to report on comparable non-executive director compensation practices and levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This report includes a review of director compensation at the same peer companies the committee considers for executive compensation practices (see Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Compensation Philosophy, Design, Process  Review of peer compensation below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the review of current market practices for directors of peer public companies, the Compensation Committee determined in December 2015 that the compensation for non-executives directors would remain the same for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation for non-executive directors for 2016 was as follows, with each fee component paid in quarterly installments in arrears:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Basic cash fee Non-executive directors (other than the Chairperson of the Board) received an annual basic fee paid in cash in the amount of $120,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairperson fee In lieu of the above basic cash fee, the Chairperson of the Board received an annual cash fee of $400,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Basic shares fee Non-executive directors also received an annual award of shares in the aggregate amount of $145,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership policy for non-executive directors  All shares granted to our non-executive directors are subject to the Non-Executive Director Stock Ownership Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy generally requires each non-executive director to achieve and thereafter maintain an ownership level of at least 18,000 shares within seven years of such directors first appointment as a non- executive director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until such ownership level is achieved, each non-executive director is generally required to continue to retain at least 50% of all shares received as compensation from the company.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation discussion and analysis This section presents a discussion and analysis of the philosophy and objectives of our Boards Compensation Committee (the committee) in designing and implementing compensation programs for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presentation has two main sections  an executive summary and an in-depth discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive summary highlights our 2016 financial performance and achievements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive summary then discusses enhancements to our executive compensation program put in place last year, followed by a brief discussion of the compensation of our chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then provide a summary of our compensation decision-making process and how the annual outcomes of company-wide compensation, including executive compensation, are greatly influenced by progress against our multi-year strategic objectives, annual operating plan and annual financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Included in the executive summary is a review of our financial results and related shareholder outcomes over the past five years to illustrate the positive results of our multi-year strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive summary then provides a discussion and illustrations of how our chief executive officers compensation is tied to our financial results and compares to that of our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The balance of the presentation has three components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a more in-depth discussion of our compensation philosophy, design and process, including the components of executive compensation and their respective purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then provide a flowchart of our 2016 compensation decision-making process and discuss each element of the flowchart in-depth  including matters we briefly described in the executive summary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We next present a detailed review of the 2016 accomplishments and compensation determinations of our chief executive officer, chief financial officer and the next three most highly compensated executive officers (our named executive officers or NEOs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lastly, the in-depth discussion sets forth our other compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 highlights In spite of challenging market conditions, Invesco continued to execute well against our strategic objectives described below, which enabled us to deliver strong, long-term investmen performance to clients and further advance our competitive position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, our financial performance for 2016 was lower year-over-year, reflecting volatile markets, numerous headwinds in the operating environment of many markets we serve and efforts to invest in our business for the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a review of the companys financial performance, our committee decided that the company-wide incentive pool should be reduced for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as part of its rigorous and judicious executive compensation decision-making, our committee determined that our chief executive officers total incentive compensation should be reduced by approximately 11%.

sentences.text: Enhancements to our executive compensation program At the 2016 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders, 79.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders, 79.7% of the votes cast were in favor of the advisory proposal to approve our named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, the committee made enhancements to the executive compensation program last year in response to shareholder feedback received in 2015 and early 2016 and the committees review of the compensation market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fall and winter of 2016, we again sought feedback on our compensation programs from our largest shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shareholders who recently provided feedback did not voice any concerns regarding our named executive officer compensation and positively acknowledged our recent changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these responses, no additional changes were made to our compensation program this year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term performance-based equity awards granted in 2017 in respect of 2016 are subject to a multi-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on feedback from shareholders, we have transitioned the performance period for our long-term performance-based equity awards from a 1-year to a 3-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee continues to believe a multi-year performance period, like the other performance-based award enhancements listed below, strengthens alignment of our executive officers compensation with client interests and shareholder success and is consistent with market best practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: year performance period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term equity awards granted in 2017 in respect of 2016 vest subject to the achievement of adjusted operating r margin, as opposed to achievement of either adjusted operating r margin or adjusted earnings per share thresholds in prior years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A focus on adjusted operating margin ensures discipline in corporate investments, initiatives and capital allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is a measure of overall strength of the business and, importantly, we believe it more effectively avoids conflicts of interest with clients than other measures could introduce.

sentences.text: Based on the companys performance for the year, the committee establishes an overall company-wide incentive pool within well-established guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pool size is limited to a percentage of pre-cash bonus operating income (PCBOI) to ensure, at all times, the company- wide incentive pool is linked to Invescos operating results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Determining the 2016 Compensation of Our Executive Officers  Determination of company-wide incentive pool based upon progress against strategic objectives and annual operating plan below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with past practice, all 2016 incentive awards, including NEO awards, were paid out of this incentive pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee makes holistic, rigorous and judicious decisions for overall incentive pool funding in the context of Invescos multi-year performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee does not attempt to rank or assign relative weight to any factor, but rather applies its judgment in considering them in their entirety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee is focused on the totality of organizational success without tying decisions to a specific formula.

sentences.text: Our strategic objectives guide our annual strategic planning process, which has helped us deliver better outcomes for clients while achieving strong results for shareholders over a multi-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management, with the guidance and input from the Board of Directors, annually reviews our multi-year strategic objectives in the context of global trends and macro themes impacting the asset management industry, our position within key markets and the financial implications of our decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The outcome of the review is an annual operating plan, composed, in part, of our business priorities and related projected financial outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the year, the Board of Directors reviews with management the performance against the annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multi-year strategic objectives Annual operating plan Board reviews performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board and management review performance against our strategic objectives and annual operating plan based on a number of factors, including those shown below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Global trends and macro themes Investment performance and flows Organizational health Efficiency and effectiveness Operating results and financial strength Shareholder returns
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROE and ROA are not appropriate measures of success for pure asset managers like Invesco.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We specifically do not rely heavily on measures of Return on Equity (ROE) or Return on Assets (ROA) as these are not as relevant in the success of a pure asset manager like Invesco.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally speaking, asset managers do not rely on balance sheet assets to generate operating income and earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business relies on client assets under management (or AUM), which are held in custody by third parties and are not owned by the company, to generate revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, US GAAP rules on consolidation require the company to consolidate certain investment product assets and liabilities which significantly distort our balance sheet and the associated financial metrics of ROE and ROA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (See Our variable incentive compensation  performance-based awards for further discussion of performance measures.)

sentences.text: Executive officer compensation decisions Following the establishment of the company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our committee makes holistic, rigorous and judicious executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the establishment of the company-wide annual incentive pool, the committee sets the compensation levels of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar to the approach that the committee follows in setting the incentive pool, the committee makes executive compensation decisions based on the totality of the results without tying decisions to a specific formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee considers a number of factors in setting the compensation levels of our executive officers, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the companys achievements in respect of our strategic objectives and annual operating plan as described above (including investment performance and flows, organizational health, efficiency and effectiveness, operating results and financial strength, and shareholder returns);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the competitive environment by reviewing performance against peers across numerous financial factors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each executive officers individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes that this thoughtful, holistic approach, which incorporates fact- based qualitative judgments, is more rigorous and effective than purely mechanical formula criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes a review of our process and outcomes demonstrates that we closely tie pay to performance and our executive compensation is appropriate when compared to the companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices Below we highlight certain executive compensation practices designed to align executive pay with performance, ensure good governance and serve our shareholders long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We tie pay to the performance of the company and the individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The great majority of executive officer compensation is not guaranteed and is variable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong emphasis on deferred compensation with long vesting periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for our executive officers is heavily weighted to deferred compensation (generally between 55-70%), consisting of annual stock deferral and long-term equity awards that vest over four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of long-term equity awards are performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of long-term equity awards for executive officers are tied to the achievement of specified levels of adjusted operating margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such performance-based equity awards are subject to a 3-year performance period, and vest on attainment of adjusted operating margin targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding long-term equity awards made to our executive officers, including our named executive officers, see Our variable incentive compensation  Our long-term equity awards below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Linkage of incentive compensation pool to PCBOI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a history of disciplined decision-making over multiple years and through various economic cycles, including directly linking the aggregate incentive compensation pool to a defined range of our pre-cash bonus operating income (PCBOI) ensuring incentive compensation is paid only when the company is generating operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding our incentive compensation pool see Determination of company-wide annual incentive pool based upon progress against strategic objectives and annual operating plan below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company maintains a clawback policy for our executive officers performance-based long-term equity awards which permits the company to recover compensation in the event of fraudulent or willful misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding our clawback policy, see Other Compensation Policies and Practices  Clawback policy below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain robust share ownership guidelines for our executive officers, creating a further link between management interests, company performance and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares must be held until the stock ownership policy requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our executive officers have exceeded the ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For F more information regarding our stock ownership policy, see Other Compensation Policies and Practices  Stock ownership policy below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double triggers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a double trigger requirement on the vesting of equity awards in the event of a change in control, meaning that an equity award holder must be terminated following the change in control before vesting will be accelerated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Modest perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide modest perquisites that provide a sound benefit to the companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent compensation committee consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent compensation consultant, Johnson Associates, Inc., is retained directly by the committee and performs no other services for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintain a cap on CEO total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation committee has set a cap of $25 million for our chief executive officers total compensation in respect to 2017, with actual pay expected to be below that level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually perform risk analysis on executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our committee annually reviews our compensation programs to determine whether such polices and practices create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum vesting for equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity incentive plans provide a minimum vesting period of two years for equity grants made beginning in 2016; however, equity awards vest over four years for time-based awards and at the end of a three- year performance period for performance-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we dont do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividends or dividend equivalents on unvested performance-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividends or dividend equivalents are paid on performance-based awards during the vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, dividends are deferred and are paid based on performance achieved, with no premiums.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No gross ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not generally provide excise tax gross ups, other than in the case of certain relocation expenses, consistent with our relocation policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No short selling, hedging or pledging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy strictly prohibits short selling, dealing in publicly-traded options and hedging or monetization transactions in our common shares and pledging our common shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No share recycling.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity incentive plans contain provisions prohibiting share recycling for stock options and stock appreciation rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy, Design and Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy To support our strategic objectives, we have structured our compensation programs at every level to achieve the following objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: align individual awards with client and shareholder success;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reinforce our commercial viability by closely linking rewards to results at every level;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reinforce our meritocracy by differentially rewarding high-performers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recognize and retain top talent by ensuring a meaningful mix of cash and deferred compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has, among other duties, responsibility for determining the components and amounts of compensation paid to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the compensation committee The committees responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) reviewing and making recommendations to the Board about the companys overall compensation philosophy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) approving the aggregate compensation pool;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) evaluating the performance of, and setting the compensation for, the Chief Executive Officer; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) reviewing and overseeing managements annual process for evaluating the performance of, and approving the compensation for, all other executive officers, including our other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making these determinations, the committee considers our performance against our strategic objectives, our success in executing annual objectives in a multi-year context, year-over-year operating results, and operating results versus peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-executive directors regularly attend compensation committee meetings, highlighting the importance of executive officer compensation decisions for our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail on the companys compensation alignment to its financial results, see Compensation Decision-Making Process and Outcomes Within a Multi-Ye - ar Context above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of executive compensation and their purpose We utilize a variety of compensation components to achieve our objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program for our executive officers, including the NEOs, consists of base salary and variable incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes the bulk of our executive officers pay should be incentive compensation  a combination of annual cash bonuses, annual stock deferral awards, and long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table further describes each pay component, as well as its purpose and key measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay element What it does Key K measures Incentive type Fixed Base salary  Provides competitive fixed pay  Reasonable base compensation for day-to-day performance of job responsibilities  Evaluated annually, generally remains static unless promotion or adjustment due to economic trends in industry  Experience, duties and scope of responsibility  Internal and external market factors Variable Annual cash bonus  Provides a competitive annual cash incentive opportunity  Based upon annual financial results and performance against long-term strategic objectives Annual stock deferral award (time-based vesting)  Along with annual cash bonus, provides a competitive annual incentive opportunity  Aligns executive with client and shareholder interests  Encourages retention by vesting in equal annual increments over four years  Based upon annual financial results and performance against long-term strategic objectives Long-term equity awards (performance- based and time-based vesting)  Recognizes long-term potential for future contributions to companys long-term strategic objectives  Aligns executive with client and shareholder interests  50% of long-term equity award is performance-based  Encourages retention by vesting in equal annual increments over four years for time-based awards and at the end of the 3-year performance period for performance-based awards  Based upon financial results and performance against long-term strategic objectives  Performance-based vesting tied to adjusted operating margin  3-year performance period for performance- based awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our variable incentive compensation As noted above, each executive officers variable compensation is a combination of an annual cash bonus, an annual stock deferral award and a long-term equity award (including a performance-based award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers incentive awards are funded from the company-wide incentive pool established annually by the compensation committee after a review of the companys progress on multiple operating measures, the companys progress toward achieving its strategic objectives and other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee does not attempt to rank or assign relative weight to any factor, but rather applies its judgment in considering them in their entirety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail on the annual company-wide incentive pool, see Determining the 2016 Compensation of Our Executive Officers below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers annual variable compensation is comprised of cash and stock deferral awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual awards We use our annual awards, which consist of cash and annual stock deferral awards, to recognize current year performance and closely align employees interests with those of clients and shareholders, differentially reward high performers and link compensation to financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual stock deferral awards generally vest over four years in 25% increments each year and typically account for approximately 20-36% of an executive officers equity incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based long- term equity awards have a three-year performance period and three-year cliff vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term equity awards Our long-term equity awards are comprised of time-based and performance-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes long-term equity awards should align employee and shareholder interests and a portion of awards should be paid only upon achievement of targeted financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the committee believes that the design of the long-term equity awards should:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: focus our management on preserving value for our shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: hold our executives accountable for the sound management of the company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tie a specific portion of our executive officers compensation to a measure that management can most directly influence that will ultimately lead to shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-based awards Fifty percent of our long-term equity awards are time-based and generally vest ratably in 25% increments each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based awards Fifty percent of our long-ter
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fifty percent of our long-term equity awards are performance based and are tied to the achievement of adjusted operating margin over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes tying the vesting of the performance-based equity awards to the achievement of adjusted operating margin over a multi-year period achieves its goals with respect to performance-based awards as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it focuses discipline in corporate investments, initiatives and capital allocation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it is consistent with the way we manage the business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it is an important measure of overall strength of an asset manager;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it is a primary measure of focus of industry analysts;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it is improved through effective management over the long term; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: it more effectively avoids conflicts of interest with clients
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial performance thresholds of the performance-based equity awards are set forth in the chart below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rigor of the thresholds, as well as the partial vesting of awards for failure to meet the target range and an upside opportunity for performance beyond the target range, align with the committees above-described philosophy regarding performance-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, we specifically do not rely heavily on measures of ROE or ROA as these are not appropriate measures of success for pure asset managers like Invesco.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (See Executive Summary  Compensation decision making process and outcomes within a multi-year context for further discussion.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based award features are summarized in the following table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail on performance-based awards, see Grants of plan-based share awards for 2016 table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based award component Performance period Three years Performance metric Adjusted operating margin Performance vesting range Vesting ranges from 0% - 150%; straight line interpolation to be used for actual result See above table for vesting ranges Vesting 3-year cliff Dividends Deferred and paid only to the extent an award vests Settlement Award settled in shares Clawback Award subject to clawback policy in the event of fraudulent or willful misconduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of executive officer incentive compensation is deferred and tied to financial and strategic performance in order to align individual rewards with long-term client and shareholder success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation mix To align our executive officers awards with client and shareholder success, the committee has designed our executive officers compensation so that executive officers receive a significant portion of their compensation in the form of deferred incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee believes this appropriately aligns our executive officers interests with our shareholders as it focuses on long- term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has no pre-established policy or target on the allocation between pay elements in order to be able to adjust practices to best meet the interest of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, 68% of our chief executives officers incentive compensation was in the form of deferred incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refined our peer group to better reflect our current business and size and to include certain companies considered to be our peers by external parties.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assists the committee throughout the year in its analysis and evaluation of our overall executive compensation programs, including compensation paid to our directors and executive officers;

sentences.text: attends certain meetings of the committee and periodically meets with the committee without members of management present;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides the committee with certain market data and analysis that compares executive compensation paid by the company with that paid by other firms in the financial services industry and certain investment management firms which we consider generally comparable to us; and

sentences.text: Each year, the committee establishes a company- wide incentive pool that is a percentage of pre-cash bonus operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All 2016 awards, including NEO awards, were paid out of this pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: against strategic objectives and annual operating plan The committee examines the companys performance on multiple operating measures, including those shown above, the companys performance toward achieving its strategic objectives and other factors, including pre-cash bonus operating income (PCBOI).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While each of these items is considered by the committee, the committee does not attempt to rank or assign relative weight to any factor but rather applies its judgment in considering them in their entirety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee is focused on the totality of organizational success without tying compensation decisions to a specific formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Linking the aggregate incentive compensation pool to a defined range of our PCBOI ensures incentive compensation is paid only when the company is generating operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee established parameters, used consistently for many years, to guide the end- of-year decision-making process regarding the company-wide incentive pool size to ensure that compensation is aligned with the financial and strategic results discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These parameters are expressed as a percentage of PCBOI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee uses a range of 34-48% of PCBOI, in the aggregate, in setting the company-wide incentive pool, though it maintains the flexibility to go outside either end of this range in circumstances that it deems exceptional.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The range includes the cash bonus and deferred compensation pools, as well as the amounts paid under sales commission plans (in which our NEOs do not participate).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The range was determined based on historical data concerning the practices of asset management and other similar financial services firms as analyzed by Johnson Associates, our independent compensation consultant, and based on data obtained from the McLagan and CaseyQuirk Performance Intelligence Study.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past five years, the incentive pool has averaged approximately 41% of PCBOI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Utilizing its judgment, and applying discretion based upon the companys financial results and progress against strategic objectives during 2016, the committee set the company-wide incentive pool for 2016 at approximately 41% of PCBOI (compared to 39% of PCBOI for 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By setting the incentive pools at 41% of PCBOI, the committee decreased the size of the incentive pools given the decline in PCBOI in respect to 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the committee determined to decrease the incentive compensation pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the cash bonus pool decreased; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual deferral awards were decreased on an average per person basis; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term equity awards generally were unchanged on an average per person basis to continue to tie the interests of our employees to the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For some highly compensated employees, the cash to deferred mix was reviewed and adjustments were made to decrease cash and increase the deferred component of their incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
