sentences.text: Award maximums for named executive officers In determining compensation for the named executive officers, the committee considers the potential impact of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) generally disallows a tax deduction to public corporations for compensation greater than $1 million paid per fiscal year to each of the corporations covered employees (generally, the Chief Executive Officer and the next three most highly compensated executive officers as of the end of any fiscal year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, compensation which qualifies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as performance-based is excluded from the $1 million per executive officer limit if, among other requirements, the compensation is payable only upon attainment of pre-established, objective performance goals under a plan approved by the companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our compensation program for executive officers, the company maintains the Executive Incentive Bonus Plan (Bonus Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bonus Plan provides for annual performance-based awards to eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For F each executive officer, the committee determines on an annual basis an award maximum under the Bonus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award maximums are expressed as a percentage of PCBOI  an objectively determined performance criteria that is intended to qualify for the performance-based exemption to the $1 million deduction limit under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award maximums pertain to the cumulative value of an executive officers annual variable compensation  consisting of the annual cash bonus, annual stock deferral award and long-term equity award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the committee determines to grant additional compensation that is not performance-based compensation to an executive officer subject to the provisions of Section 162(m), the additional compensation will be subject to the $1 million deduction limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It provides that, before the company engages the independent auditor to render any service, the engagement must either be specifically approved by the Audit Committee or fall into one of the defined categories that have been pre-approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy defines the services and the estimated range of fees for such services that the committee has pre-approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of any such categorical approval is 12 months, unless the committee specifically provides otherwise, and the policy requires the related fee levels to be set annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where actual invoices in respect of any service are materially in excess of the estimated range, the committee must approve such excess amount prior to payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also prohibits the company from engaging the auditors to provide certain defined non-audit services that are prohibited under SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, the Audit Committee may delegate pre-approval authority to one or more of its members, but may not delegate such authority to the companys management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, our management must inform the Audit Committee of each service performed by our independent auditor pursuant to the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This requirement normally is satisfied by a report issued to the Audit Committee from the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests to the Audit Committee for separate approval must be submitted by both the independent auditor and our chief financial officer and the request must include a joint statement as to whether it is deemed consistent with the SECs and PCAOBs rules on auditor independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transaction Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted written Policies and Procedures with Respect to Related Person Transactions to address the review, approval, disapproval or ratification of related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons include the companys executive officers, directors, director nominees, holders of more than five percent (5%) of the companys voting securities, immediate family members of the foregoing persons, and any entity in which any of the foregoing persons is employed, is a partner or is in a similar position, or in which such person has a 5% or greater ownership interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A related person transaction means a transaction or series of transactions in which the company participates, the amount involved exceeds $120,000, and a related person has a direct or indirect interest (with certain exceptions permitted by SEC rules).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is required to present for the approval or ratification of the Audit Committee all material information regarding an actual or potential related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is required to present for the approval or ratification of the Audit Committee all material information regarding an actual or potential related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy requires that, after reviewing such information, the disinterested members of the Audit Committee will approve or disapprove the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval will be given only if the Audit Committee determines that such transaction is in, or is not inconsistent with, the best interests of the company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy further requires that in the event management becomes aware of a related person transaction that has not been previously approved or ratified, it must be submitted to the Audit Committee promptly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also permits the chairperson of the Audit Committee to review and approve related person transactions in accordance with the terms of the policy between scheduled committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any determination made pursuant to this delegated authority must be reported to the full Audit Committee at the next regularly scheduled meeting.

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2 - Advisory Vote to Approve the Companys Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General The Dodd
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010 (the Dodd Frank Act) enables our shareholders to vote to approve, on an advisory (nonbinding) basis, the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement in accordance with the SECs rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our shareholders to indicate their support for our named executive officer compensation as described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal, commonly known as a say-on-pay proposal, gives our shareholders the opportunity to express their views on our named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is not intended to address any specific item of compensation, but rather the overall compensation of our named executive officers and the philosophy, policies and practices described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our shareholders to vote FOR the following resolution at the Annual General Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, L that the Companys shareholders approve, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, the compensation of the named executive officers, as disclosed in the Companys Proxy Statement for the 2017 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders pursuant to the Securities and Exchange Commissions compensation disclosure rules, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and related narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invescos compensation programs, particularly our annual incentive pools, are tied to the achievement of our strategic objectives and financial results and our success in serving our clients and shareholders interests, as further described in Executive Compensation above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering their vote, we urge shareholders to review the information included in this proxy statement in Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors and our Compensation Committee value the opinions of our shareholders and have established a process to facilitate communication by shareholders with board members as described in Shareholder Outreach and Communications with the Board in A Letter to Our Shareholders from the Chairperson of Our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The extent there is any significant vote against the named executive officer compensation as disclosed in this proxy statement, we will consider our shareholders concerns, and the Compensation Committee will evaluate whether any actions are necessary to address those concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards current policy, shareholders are given an opportunity to cast an advisory vote on this topic annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders, 79.7% of the votes cast were in favor of the advisory proposal to approve our named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee made enhancements to the executive compensation program last year in response to shareholder feedback received in 2015 and early 2016 and the committees review of the compensation market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the fall and winter of 2016, we again sought feedback on our compensation programs from our largest shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shareholders who recently provided feedback did not voice any concerns regarding our named executive officer compensation and positively acknowledged our recent changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these responses, no additional changes were made to our compensation program this year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the section entitled Executive Compensation for detail on our executive compensation program and awards approved this year and a market review of compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the board THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY R L ECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE APPROVAL OF THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, AS DISCLOSED IN THIS PROXY STATEMENT T PURSUANT TO THE COMPENSATION DISCLOSURE RULES OF THE SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal requires the affirmative vote of a majority of votes cast at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3  Advisory Vote on Frequency of Executive Compensation Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General The Dodd-Frank Act also enables our shareholders to indicate, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, how frequently we should seek an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers, as we do above in Proposal No. 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting on this Proposal No. 3, shareholders may indicate whether they would prefer an advisory vote on named executive officer compensation once every one, two, or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration of this Proposal, our Board of Directors has determined that an advisory vote on executive compensation that occurs every year is the most appropriate alternative for the company at this time, and therefore our Board of Directors recommends that you vote for a one-year interval for the advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In formulating its recommendation, our Board of Directors considered that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation will allow our shareholders to provide us with their direct input on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy statement every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with our policy of seeking input from, and engaging in discussions with, our shareholders on our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices and corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote on your preferred voting frequency by choosing the option of one year, two years, three years or abstain from voting when you vote in response to the resolution set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, L that the option of once every one year, two years, or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast for this resolution will be determined to be the preferred frequency for the advisory vote with respect to which the Company is to hold a shareholder vote to approve the compensation of the named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to the Securities and Exchange Commissions compensation disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of one year, two years or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast by shareholders will be the preferred frequency with which the company is to hold the advisory vote by the shareholders on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and not binding on the Board of Directors or the company, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and the company to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the option approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the board THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSL Y R L ECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE OPTION OF ONCE EVERY ONE YEAR AS THE FREQUENCY W C ITH WHICH SHAREHOLDERS PROVIDE AN ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION, AS DISCLOSED PURSUANT TO THE COMPENSATION DISCLOSURE RULES OF THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 4  Amendment of Companys Second Amended and Restated Bye-Laws to Implement Proxy Access and Other Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General The Board of Directors has unanimously adopted and is submitting for shareholder approval amendments (collectively, the Amendments) to the Second Amended and Restated Bye-Laws of the company (the Bye-Laws) that would
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) implement proxy access,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) implement a plurality voting standard in contested director elections, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) remove references to the phased-in declassification provisions of the Bye-Laws regarding the election of directors since such provisions will be fully implemented at the upcoming Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of proxy access amendments Proxy access allows eligible shareholders to include their director nominees in the companys proxy materials for an annual general meeting of shareholders, along with the candidates nominated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to considering the views of our shareholders and believes that the companys proxy access proposal includes requirements and provisions designed to provide meaningful rights of proxy access to our long-term shareholders who have full economic interest in our shares while reducing risks of abuse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Amendments would become effective upon the required approval (described below) by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following description of the Amendments regarding proxy access is only a summary and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the Amendments, which is attached to this Proxy Statement as Appendix C.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible shareholders who have continuously maintained qualifying ownership of at least 3% of the companys outstanding shares for at least the previous three years would generally be permitted to use the companys proxy statement to nominate, at the companys annual general meeting of shareholders, a number of eligible director candidates equal to the greater of two and the largest whole number that does not exceed 20% of the number of directors in office as of the last day on which a proxy access notice may be delivered, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Bye-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders would be permitted to aggregate their continuously held shares in order to meet the 3% threshold, and up to 20 shareholders would be permitted to group their shares in order to meet the ownership threshold requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to facilitate the workability and usability of proxy access, members of fund families would be counted as one shareholder for purposes of the 20-person aggregation limit, rather than treated as separate shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Calculation of qualifying ownership In order to increase the likelihood that the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating shareholders would be considered to own only the shares for which the shareholder possesses both
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the full voting and investment rights pertaining to the shares and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the full economic interest in (including the opportunity for profit and risk of loss on) such shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares would not count if they have been sold in any transaction that has not been settled or closed, including any short sale;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares would not count if they have been borrowed or purchased pursuant to an agreement to resell; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares would not count if they are subject to derivative or similar arrangements, whether any such instrument or agreement is to be settled with shares, cash or other consideration, which instrument or agreement has, or is intended to have, the purpose or effect of reducing the full voting and investment rights pertaining to such shares and/or / hedging, offsetting or altering the full economic interest in such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to recallable loaned shares, a shareholder will be deemed for this purpose to still have voting rights over otherwise owned shares of the companys outstanding common stock that the shareholder has loaned, so long as the shareholder has the power to recall such loaned shares on not more than five business days notice and includes in its proxy access notice an agreement that it will promptly recall such loaned shares upon being notified that any of its director nominees will be included in the companys proxy materials and will continue to hold such recalled shares through the date of the annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: access (Nominee limit) The maximum number of shareholder-nominated candidates nominated by all eligible shareholders that the company would be required to include in its proxy materials would be equal to the greater of two and the largest whole number that does not exceed 20% of the number of directors in office as of the last day on which a proxy access notice may be delivered, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Bye-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the companys current Board size of 9 directors, the maximum number of proxy access candidates that the company would be required to include in its proxy materials for an annual general meeting is two.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of permitted candidates would include director nominees submitted under the proxy access procedures but who are later withdrawn or withdraw or that the Board includes in the companys proxy materials as Board-nominated candidates, as well as directors in office for whom proxy access was previously provided or requested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously elected proxy access candidates would continue to count towards the nomination cap until they have served as Board nominees for two terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, any director candidate included in the companys proxy materials pursuant to a non-proxy access agreement between the company and a shareholder would generally count towards the nomination cap until he or she has served as a Board nominee for two terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reductions in the size of the Board would result in a re-calculation of the number of available proxy access seats.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company will not be required to include any proxy access candidates in its proxy materials for any annual general meeting for which a shareholder nominates one or more director candidates outside the proxy access process pursuant to the advance notice requirements of the Bye-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nomination deadline for proxy access Requests to include shareholder-nominated candidates in the companys proxy materials for an annual general meeting pursuant to the proposed proxy access mechanism must be received within the time period set forth in the advance notice provisions of the Bye-Laws or, specifically, not less than 90 nor more than 120 days prior to the first anniversary of the preceding years annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information required from nominating shareholders Each shareholder seeking to include a director nominee in the companys proxy materials is required to provide certain information to the company, including with respect to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proof of qualifying stock ownership;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information relating to the shareholders and its share ownership of the sort required under the Bye-Laws to be submitted in connection with non-proxy access shareholder nominees; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 63  Compensation and other monetary arrangements with a person or entity other than the company in connection with such shareholder nominee's candidacy for director or action as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating shareholders would also be required to make certain representations to and agreements with the company, including with respect to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having acquired the shares in the ordinary course of business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lack of intent to change or influence control of the company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing accurate and complete information and disclosures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Complying with applicable laws and regulations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assumption of liability and associated indemnification of covered matters and persons;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Refraining from nominating persons for election to the Board other than the shareholders nominee(s) submitted through the proxy access process and related restrictions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Refraining from distributing to shareholders any form of proxy statement or proxy card other than the form distributed by the company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Filing solicitations with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information required of director nominees submitted through proxy access Each director nominee submitted under the proxy access mechanism is required to provide certain information to the company and make certain written representations to and agreements with the company, including with respect to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consenting to being named in the companys proxy statement and serving as a director, if elected;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing the same information required of non-proxy access shareholder nominees under the Bye-Laws;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completing all questionnaires, representations and agreements required by the Bye-Laws or of the companys directors generally; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing such additional information necessary to determine if the director nominee is independent under applicable independence standards and if the nominee otherwise qualifies under the companys proxy access Bye-Law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Inclusion of supporting statement A nominating shareholder would be permitted to include in the companys proxy statement for the applicable annual general meeting a 500-word statement in support of each of its director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company may omit information and statements that the company, in good faith, believes are materially false or misleading, or would violate applicable laws or regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: nominees in the proxy statement The company would not be required to include a director nominee in the companys proxy materials under the proposed proxy access mechanism (or permit their nomination pursuant to such mechanism) if:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The requirements set forth in the proxy access bye-law are not met;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee is not independent under applicable stock exchange standards, any applicable rules of the SEC and any publicly disclosed standards used by the Board in determining and disclosing independence of the companys directors, as determined by the Board in its sole discretion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee does not meet the audit committee independence requirements under applicable stock exchange rules and securities laws, as determined by the Board in its sole discretion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee is not an outside director for the purposes of Section 162(m) of the Code, as determined by the Board in its sole discretion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of the director nominee would cause the company to violate the Bye-Laws, stock exchange requirements or any other applicable law, rule or regulation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee is or has been, within the past three years, an employee, officer or director of, or otherwise affiliated with, a competitor, as defined in Section 8 of the Clayton Antitrust Act of 1914;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee is or has been a named subject of a pending criminal proceeding (excluding non-criminal traffic violations) or has been convicted in such a criminal proceeding within the past ten years, or who is or has been a named subject of any legal proceeding as a result of which the service of such director nominee on the Board would result in any restrictions on the ability of the company to conduct business in any jurisdiction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee has provided information to the company with respect to his or her nomination that is untrue or otherwise misleading in any material respect, as determined by the Board in its sole discretion; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominee or the nominating shareholder breaches in any material respect applicable obligations, agreements or representations under the proxy access provisions or does not maintain eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proxy access director nominee who either withdraws from or becomes ineligible or unavailable for election at an annual general meeting (other than by reason of disability or other health reason) or who does not receive at least twenty-five percent (25%) of the votes cast in favor of his or her election will be ineligible to be included as a director nominee in the companys proxy materials under the proxy access mechanism for the next two annual general meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other terms and conditions as set forth in the Bye-Laws would also apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: elections In connection with implementing the proxy access process described above, we provide that our Bye-Laws also will be amended to implement a plurality voting standard in contested director elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A contested director election could arise if shareholders nominate director candidates, through the proxy access process or otherwise, in addition to those director candidates nominated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such circumstances the number of nominees would exceed the number of available board seats.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the plurality standard, the nominees elected will be those who receive the greatest number of votes cast even if some or all of those nominees do not receive a majority of the votes cast in the election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A plurality voting standard in a contested election addresses the possibility that none of the director nominees will receive a majority of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It ensures that directors will be elected to fill all available board seats.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of amendments to remove phased-in declassification provisions In May 2014 our shareholders approved amendments to Bye-Law 8(3) to eliminate the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Description of amendments to remove phased-in declassification provisions In May 2014 our shareholders approved amendments to Bye-Law 8(3) to eliminate the three classes of members of the Board of Directors, over a period of three annual elections of directors, whereby all director nominees would be elected annually for a one-year term  commonly referred to as phased-in declassification of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The phased-in declassification of our Board will be completed with the election of all director nominees for a one-year term at this upcoming Annual General Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the company is seeking shareholder approval to further amend Bye-Law 8(3) to remove the references to the phased-in declassification provisions in Bye-Law 8(3) and to provide that all directors will be elected annually for a one-year term expiring at the next annual general meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposed amendments to the bye-laws Appendix C shows the proposed changes to Bye-Laws 8 and 10 to implement proxy access, plurality voting in contested director elections and to remove the references to the phased-in declassification of the Board of Directors, with deletions indicated by strikeouts and additions indicated by underlining.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are urged to read the Amendments in their entirety.

sentences.text: General Information Regarding the Annual General Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Questions and answers about voting your common shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. Why did I receive this Proxy Statement?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have received these proxy materials because Invescos Board of Directors is soliciting your proxy to vote your shares at the Annual General Meeting on May 11, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement includes information that is designed to assist you in voting your shares and information that we are required to provide to you under SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What is a proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy is a written authorization from you to another person that allows such person (the proxy holder) to vote your shares on your behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is asking you to allow any of the following persons to vote your shares at the Annual General Meeting: Ben F. Johnson III, Chairperson of the Board of Directors; Martin L. Flanagan, President and Chief Executive Officer; Loren M. Starr, Senior Managing Director and Chief Financial Officer; Colin D. Meadows, Senior Managing Director and Chief Administrative Officer and Kevin M. Carome, Senior Managing Director and General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. Why did I not receive my proxy materials in the mail?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by rules of the SEC, Invesco is making this Proxy Statement and its Annual Report on Form F 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 (Annual  Report) available to its shareholders electronically via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The e-proxy process expedites shareholders receipt of proxy materials and lowers the costs and reduces the environmental impact of our Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 24, 2017, we mailed to shareholders of record as of the close of business on March 13, 2017 (Record Date) a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) containing instructions on how to access this Proxy Statement, our Annual Report and other soliciting materials via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice by mail, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials in the mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Notice instructs you on how to access and review all of the important information contained in the Proxy Statement and Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also instructs you on how you may submit your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice by mail and would like to receive a printed copy of our proxy materials, you should follow the instructions included in the Notice for requesting such materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. Who is entitled to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: e
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each holder of record of Invesco common shares on the Record Date for the Annual General Meeting is entitled to attend and vote at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What is the difference between holding shares as a shareholder of record and as a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are a shareholder of record if at the close of business on the Record Date your shares were registered directly in your name with Computershare, our transfer agent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: r You are a beneficial owner if at the close of business on the Record Date your shares were held by a brokerage firm or other nominee and not in your name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Being a beneficial owner means that, like most of our shareholders, your shares are held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your broker or nominee how to vote your shares by following the voting instructions your broker or other nominee provides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide your broker or nominee with instructions on how to vote your shares, your broker or nominee will be able to vote your shares with respect to some of the proposals, but not all.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see What if I return a signed proxy or voting instruction card, but do not specify how my shares are to be voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: below for additional information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco has requested banks, brokerage firms and other nominees who hold Invesco common shares on behalf of beneficial owners of the common shares as of the close of business on the Record Date to forward the Notice to those beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco has agreed to pay the reasonable expenses of the banks, brokerage firms and other nominees for forwarding these materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. How many votes do I have?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every holder of a common share on the Record Date will be entitled to one vote per share for each Director to be elected at the Annual General Meeting and to one vote per share on each other matter presented at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the Record Date there were 406,780,301 common shares outstanding and entitled to vote at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What proposals are being presented at the Annual General Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco intends to present proposals numbered one through five for shareholder consideration and voting at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These proposals are for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1 Election of nine (9) members of the Board of Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 Advisory vote to approve the companys executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3 Advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on the companys executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4 To a T mend the companys Second Amended and Restated Bye-Laws to implement proxy access and other matters; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5 Appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the matters set forth in this Proxy Statement and matters incident to the conduct of the Annual General Meeting, Invesco does not know of any business or proposals to be considered at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other business is proposed and properly presented at the Annual General Meeting, the proxies received from our shareholders give the proxy holders the authority to vote on such matter in their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. How does the Board of Directors recommend that I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR EVERY 1 YEAR for the advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on the companys executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the amendment of the companys Second Amended and Restated Bye-Laws to implement proxy access and other matters; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. How do I attend the Annual General Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders are invited to attend the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An admission ticket (or other proof of share ownership) and some form of government-issued photo identification (such as a valid drivers license or passport) will be required for admission to the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders who own Invesco common shares as of the close of business on the Record Date and invited guests will be entitled to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An admission ticket will serve as verification of your ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registration will begin at 12:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Time and the Annual General Meeting will begin at 1:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your Invesco shares are registered in your name and you received or accessed your proxy materials electronically via the Internet, click the appropriate box on the electronic proxy card or follow the telephone instructions when prompted and an admission ticket will be held for you at the check-in area at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received your proxy materials by mail and voted by completing your proxy card and checked the box indicating that you plan to attend the meeting, an admission ticket will be held for you at the check-in area at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your Invesco shares are held in a bank or brokerage account, contact your bank or broker to obtain a written legal proxy in order to vote your shares at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not obtain a legal proxy from your bank or broker, you will not be entitled to vote your shares, but you can still attend the Annual General Meeting if you bring a recent bank or brokerage statement showing that you owned Invesco common shares on March 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should report to the check-in area for admission to the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. How do I vote and what are the voting deadlines?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares in person at the Annual General Meeting or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are three ways to vote by proxy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Via the Internet: You can submit a proxy via the Internet until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on May 10, 2017, by accessing the web site at http://www.envisonreports.com/IVZ and following the instructions you will find on the web site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet proxy submission is available 24 hours a day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You Y will be given the opportunity to confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone: T You can submit a proxy by telephone until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on May 10, 2017, by calling toll-free 1-800-652-VOTE (8683) (from the U.S. and Canada) and following the instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Mail: If you have received your proxy materials by mail, you can vote by marking, dating and signing your proxy card and returning it by mail in the enclosed postage-paid envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your common shares in an account with a bank or broker (i.e., in street name), you can vote by following the instructions on the voting instruction card provided to you by your bank or broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy cards returned by mail must be received no later than the close of business on May 10, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to be present at the Annual General Meeting, we encourage you to vote your common shares by proxy using one of the methods described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invesco shareholders of record who attend the meeting may vote their common shares in person, even though they have sent in proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What if I hold restricted shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For participants in the 2016 Global Equity Incentive Plan and the 2011 Global Equity Incentive Plan who hold restricted share awards through the companys stock plan administrator, your restricted shares will be voted as you instruct the custodian for such shares, Invesco Ltd. (the Custodian).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are three ways to vote: via the Internet, by telephone or by returning your voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please follow the instructions included on your voting instruction card on how to vote using one of the three methods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote will serve as voting instructions to the Custodian for your restricted shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide instructions regarding your restricted shares, the Custodian will not vote them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You cannot vote your restricted shares in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow sufficient time for voting by the Custodian, the Custodian must receive your vote by no later than 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time on May 5, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. May I change or revoke my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: e
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may change your vote in one of several ways at any time before it is cast prior to the applicable deadline for voting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant a subsequent proxy via the Internet or telephone;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submit another proxy card (or voting instruction card) with a date later than your previously delivered proxy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notify our Company Secretary in writing before the Annual General Meeting that you are revoking your proxy or, if you hold your shares in street name, follow the instructions on the voting instruction card; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record, or a beneficial owner with a proxy from the shareholder of record, vote in person at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What will happen if I do not vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the shareholder of record and you do not vote in person at the Annual General Meeting, or by proxy via the Internet, by telephone, or by mail, your shares will not be voted at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of your shares, your broker or nominee may vote your shares only on those proposals on which it has discretion to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under NYSE rules, your broker or nominee has discretion to vote your shares on routine matters, such as Proposal No. 5, but does not have discretion to vote your shares on non-routine matters, such as Proposals No. 1, 2, 3, or 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, if you do not instruct your broker as to how to vote your shares on Proposals No. 1, 2, 3, or 4, this would be a broker non-vote, and your shares would not be counted as having been voted on the applicable proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We therefore strongly encourage you to instruct your broker or nominee on how you wish to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What is the effect of a broker non-vote or abstention?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under NYSE rules, brokers or other nominees who hold shares for a beneficial owner have the discretion to vote on a limited number of routine proposals when they have not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner at least ten days prior to the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a broker or other nominee does not receive such voting instructions and does not have the discretion to vote the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Bermuda law, broker non-votes and abstentions are not included in the determination of the common shares voting on such matter, but are counted for quorum purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What if I return a signed proxy or voting instruction card, but do not specify how my shares are to be voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and you submit a proxy, but you do not provide voting instructions, all of your shares will be voted FOR Proposals No. 1, 2, 4 and 5 and FOR EVERY 1 YEAR for Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner and you do not provide the broker or other nominee that holds your shares with voting instructions, the broker or other nominee will determine if it has the discretionary authority to vote on the particular matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under NYSE rules, brokers and other nominees have the discretion to vote on routine matters, such as Proposal No. 5, but do not have discretion to vote on non-routine matters, such as Proposals No. 1, 2, 3, and 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, if you do not provide voting instructions to your broker or other nominee, your broker or other nominee may only vote your shares on Proposal No. 5 and any other routine matters properly presented for a vote at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What does it mean if I receive more than one Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: s
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It means you own Invesco common shares in more than one account, such as individually and jointly with your spouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote all of your common shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see Householding of Proxy Materials below for information on how you may elect to receive only one Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What is a quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: m
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum is necessary to hold a valid meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence, in person, of two or more persons representing, in person or by proxy, more than fifty percent (50%) of the issued and outstanding common shares entitled to vote at the meeting as of the Record Date constitutes a quorum for the conduct of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What vote is required in order to approve each proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each proposal, other than Proposals No. 3 and No. 4, the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast on such proposal at the Annual General Meeting is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Bye-Laws, a majority of the votes cast means the number of shares voted for a proposal must exceed 50% of the votes cast with respect to such proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes cast include only votes cast with respect to shares present in person or represented by proxy and excludes abstentions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Proposal No. 3, the option of one year, two years or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast by shareholders (a plurality) will be the frequency for the advisory vote on executive compensation that has been selected by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and not binding on the Board of Directors or Invesco, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and Invesco to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently than the choice approved by a plurality of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Proposal No. 4, the affirmative vote of at least 75% of the issued and outstanding shares of the company is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bermuda law and our Bye-Laws do not recognize a voting standard lower than a majority of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, since in Proposal No. 3 we are asking shareholders to select from four (4) different alternatives (one year, two years, three years or abstain), it is possible that none of these alternatives will receive such a majority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we are asking shareholders to approve the plurality standard as part of your vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. How will voting on any other business be conducted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the matters set forth in this Proxy Statement and matters incident to the conduct of the Annual General Meeting, we do not know of any business or proposals to be considered at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other business is proposed and properly presented at the Annual General Meeting, the persons named as proxies will vote on the matter in their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. What happens if the Annual General Meeting is adjourned or postponed?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy will still be effective and will be voted at the rescheduled Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will still be able to change or revoke your proxy until it is voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. Who will count the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of Computershare, our transfer agent, will act as the inspector of election and will tabulate the votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q. How can I find the results of the Annual General Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preliminary results will be announced at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final results will be published in a Current Report on Form F 8-K that we will file with the SEC within four (4) business days after the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important additional information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Costs of solicitation The cost of solicitation of proxies will be paid by Invesco.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have retained Alliance Advisors LLC to solicit proxies for a fee of approximately $18,000 plus a reasonable amount to cover expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may also be solicited in person, by telephone or electronically by Invesco personnel who will not receive additional compensation for such solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of proxy materials and our Annual Report will be supplied to brokers and other nominees for the purpose of soliciting proxies from beneficial owners, and we will reimburse such brokers or other nominees for their reasonable expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presentation of financial statements In accordance with Section 84 of the Companies Act 1981 of Bermuda, Invescos audited consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 will be presented at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These statements have been approved by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no requirement under Bermuda law that these statements be approved by shareholders, and no such approval will be sought at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registered and principal executive offices The registered office of Invesco is located at Canons Court, 22 Victoria Street, Hamilton HM12, Bermuda.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal executive office of Invesco is located at 1555 Peachtree Street N.E., Atlanta, Georgia 30309, and the telephone number there is 1-404-892-0896.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder proposals for the 2018 annual general meeting In accordance with the rules established by the SEC, any share
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the rules established by the SEC, any shareholder proposal submitted pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act intended for inclusion in the proxy statement for next years annual general meeting of shareholders must be received by Invesco no later than 120 days before the anniversary of the date of this proxy statement (e.g., not later than November 24, 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such proposals should be sent to our Company Secretary in writing to Invesco Ltd., Attn: Office of the Company Secretary, 1555 Peachtree Street N.E., Atlanta, Georgia 30309, or by email to company.secretary@invesco.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process, which is commonly referred to as householding, potentially means extra convenience for shareholders and cost savings for companies.

sentences.text: As used in this Bye-Law 10, shares beneficially owned shall mean all shares as to which such Person, together with such Persons affiliates and associates (as defined in Rule 12b-2 under the Exchange Act), may be deemed to beneficially own pursuant to Rules 13d-3 and 13d-5 under the Exchange Act, as well as all shares as to which such Person, together with such Persons affiliates and associates, has the right to become the beneficial owner pursuant to any agreement or understanding, or upon the exercise of warrants, options or rights to convert or exchange (whether such rights are exercisable immediately or only after the passage of time or the occurrence of conditions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The person presiding at the meeting shall determine whether such notice has been duly given and shall direct that proposals and nominees not be considered if such notice has not been so given.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this by- law, public announcement shall mean disclosure in a press release reported by the Dow Jones News Service, Associated Press or comparable national news service or in a document publicly filed by the Company with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to Section 13, 14 or 15(d) of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In no event shall the public announcement of an adjournment or postponement of an annual meeting or a special meeting commence a new time period for the giving of a Shareholders notice (43) as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chairperson of the annual general meeting of Shareholders or special general meeting shall, if the facts warrant, refuse to acknowledge a proposal or nomination not made in compliance with the foregoing procedure and any such proposal or nomination not properly brought before the meeting shall not be considered.
